prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.0017) with no rotation. Then, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. To create the sketch: 1. Draw line 1: Starting at (0, 0) and ending at (0.0268, 0). 2. Draw line 2: Starting at (0.0268, 0) and ending at (0.0268, 0.75). 3. Draw line 3: Starting at (0.0268, 0.75) and ending at (0, 0.75). 4. Draw line 4: Starting at (0, 0.75) and ending at (0, 0). Now, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 and transform it into a 3D sketch. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0017 units in the opposite direction of the normal to complete part 1. Part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with a smooth, curved shape and a reflective surface. Create a new coordinate system at (0.0049, 0.7281, 0.0017) with no rotation. Then, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. To create the sketch: 1. Draw circle 1 (loop 1): With a center at (0.0085, 0.0085) and a radius of 0.0085. 2. Draw circle 2 (loop 2): With a center at (0.0085, 0.0085) and a radius of 0.0072. Now, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.017 and transform it into a 3D sketch. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0357 units in the direction of the normal to complete part 2. Part 3 Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a tapered end. Create a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0) with euler angles [0, 0, 180] and a translation vector of (0, 0.0604, 0) so that the Z-axis faces downwards. Then, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. To create the sketch: 1. Draw line 1: Starting at (0, 0) and ending at (0.0268, 0.0604). 2. Draw line 2: Starting at (0.0268, 0.0604) and ending at (0, 0.0604). 3. Draw line 3: Starting at (0, 0.0604) and ending at (0, 0). Now, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0604 and transform it into a 3D sketch. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0126 units in the opposite direction of the normal to complete part 3. These detailed instructions should help a junior CAD designer generate an accurate CAD model based on the given CAD assembly JSON. Note that no specific boolean operations are mentioned in the instructions; instead, the natural language descriptions are used as outlined in the task.</description>

The dimensions of part 2 are approximately: * Height: 0.375 * Width: 0.375 * Length: 0.375 Combine part 1 and part 2 to form the final shape: * Align part 2 along the x- and z-axes relative to part 1. * Perform a "Combine Bodies" operation, selecting "Intersect" to create the final shape. The final shape has the following dimensions: * Height: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Length: 0.75</description>
